title: Still Life

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of graphite on cream wove paper.

description: Giorgio Morandi was committed to the genre of still life, which was a staple of his art for more than 40 years. He said, “Nothing is more surreal . . . more abstract than reality.” Like Cézanne, Morandi explored the illusion of vision by depicting three dimensional objects so that they seem to be apparitions. The bowls and teacups seen here were drawn as flat shapes that seem light and ephemeral.
inscriptions: Signed and dated recto, lower right, in graphite: "Morandi 1943"; inscribed verso, in pen and brown ink, as part of Gallery stamp: "N. 3203 / 2"
credit_line: Gift of Dorothy Braude Edinburg to the Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection
publication_history:
Massimo Carrà, “Carrà e Morandi,” L’Arte Moderna 9 (1967), p. 118 (ill.).

Neri Pozza, Morandi: Drawings (Rome: Franca May, 1978), n.p. (ill.).

Efrem Tavoni, Morandi Disegni (Bologna: La Casa dell’Arte, 1984), p. 96, no. 360.

Efrem Tavoni and Maria Teresa Morandi, Morandi Disegni: Catalogo generale (Milan: Electa, 1994), p. 76, no. 1943 8, pl. 1943 8.

Suzanne Folds McCullagh (ed.), Drawings in Dialogue: Old Master Through Modern, The Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection, exh. cat. (Chicago: The Art Institute of Chicago, 2006), p. 215, cat. 162 (ill.).
exhibition_history:
Caracas, Fundacíon Mendóza, "Omagio a Giorgio Morandi," Nov. 1–Dec. 15, 1965, cat. 34.

Caracas, La Sala Mendóza, "Giorgio Morandi, un homenaje. En la colección José Luiz y Beatriz Plaza," Apr. 24–May 31, 1986, cat. 3.

Art Institute of Chicago, "Drawings in Dialogue: Old Master Through Modern, The Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection," June 3–July 30, 2006, p. 215, cat. 162 (ill.).

Art Institute of Chicago, "The Thrill of the Chase: Drawings for the Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection," March 15-June 15, 2014, no cat.
provenance_text: Galleria del Milione, Milan [stamps (GALLERIA DEL MILIONE / Porta Nuova N. 14 – MILANO) and (IL MILIONE [?] / VIA MANZONI 20 / MILANO) verso, lower left and lower right, in purple].  Galleria Annunciata, Milan [stamp (GALLERIA ANNUNCIATA/ [?]) verso, lower right].  José L. and Beatriz Plaza, Caracas, Venezuela, by 1965 [Caracas 1965 exh. cat.]; sold, Sotheby’s, New York, May 16, 1997, lot 33, to Dorothy Braude Edinburg, Brookline, MA; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 2013.
